title: Somerford Keynes and Neigh Bridge Country Park Walk Route

images.title: Peter Watkins / River Thames at Kemble Mill Somerford Keynes
images.caption: River Thames at Kemble Mill Somerford Keynes. Kemble Mill is the third mill down from the source. The river is forced through the gap which can just be seen beneath the mill, where it catches the light from beyond. Just a few yards aside from the Thames Trail, the view is from a footbridge carrying a public footpath over the river.

images.title: Somerford Keynes church and manor house by Philip Halling, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Somerford Keynes church and manor house

images.title: River Thames at Somerford Keynes by Philip Halling, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Thames at Somerford Keynes

images.title: Peter Watkins / The Bakers Arms Somerford Keynes
images.caption: The Bakers Arms Somerford Keynes. Somerford Keynes is a linear village mostly in the Cotswold vernacular. Note grey "North Cerney" stone and limestone roofing slates. The pub is a popular stop on the Thames Trail long distance footpath.

images.title: Reiner Tegtmeyer / Young Thames crossing at Neigh Bridge Country Park
images.caption: Young Thames crossing at Neigh Bridge Country Park

description: This walk visits Neigh Bridge Lake in the Cotswold Water Park in Gloucestershire. The lake has a nice circular footpath to follow around the water for a distance of just under a mile. There's a car park right next to the lake or you could stroll down from the nearby village of Somerford Keynes. This walk starts from the car park and circles the lake before heading along the Thames Path to visit Kemble Mill and the village. Here you can enjoy views of the 15th century manor house and the 13th century church. Nearby there's also the Cotswold Sculpture Park where there are more than 170 individual sculptures from local and international artists. There's also a nice tea room where you can grab some refreshments here. Just beyond that is Cotswold Country Park where there's the largest inland beach in the UK.
